alert.note: Alert for Barry; Lawrence; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 12:10AM CDT until August 14 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN BARRY, SOUTHERN LAWRENCE AND NEWTON COUNTIES... At 1210 AM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Neosho, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Seneca, Marionville, Granby, Pierce City, Diamond, Verona, Loma Linda, Stotts City, Newtonia, Pioneer, Halltown, Freistatt, Wentworth, Stark City, Ritchey, Hoberg, Chesapeake and Racine. This includes the following low water crossings... Turnback Creek at County Road 2100, High School Branch at McCord Street, Hickory Creek at Coler RD, Buffalo Creek at Finch Drive, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Spring River at County Road 2110 and Center Creek at Azalea Drive. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
